fields.description:
Instances launched by normal user can not be registered with eucalyptus admin credentials after admin user run BundleInstance command.

Here is the steps for reproduction.

Created a account named "hyderabad" and created normal user named "amberpe"

{code}[root@odc-d-06-05 ~]# euare-accountcreate -a hyderabad
hyderabad	000548044427
[root@odc-d-06-05 ~]# euare-usercreate -u james --as-account hyderabad

[root@odc-d-06-05 ~]# euare-accountlist
(eucalyptus)aws-exec-read	000984236640
(eucalyptus)imaging	000001195458
hyderabad	000548044427
(eucalyptus)cloudformation	000630755093
(eucalyptus)database	000839692243
(eucalyptus)loadbalancing	000359279138
eucalyptus	000952323987
(eucalyptus)objectstorage	000080427407
(eucalyptus)blockstorage	000613973154
[root@odc-d-06-05 ~]# {code}


Only two users exist in account "hyderabad"

{code}[root@odc-d-06-05 ~]# euare-userlistbypath --as-account hyderabad
arn:aws:iam::000548044427:user/admin
arn:aws:iam::000548044427:user/james {code} 

Downloaded credentials for user "james" and sourced the eucarc.

{code}[root@odc-d-06-05 ~]# mkdir .euca-james
[root@odc-d-06-05 ~]# cd .euca-amberpet/
[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]# euca_conf --cred-account hyderabad --cred-user james --get-credentials jamse.zip
[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]# ls
james.zip
[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]# unzip -o james.zip 
Archive:  james.zip
To setup the environment run: source /path/to/eucarc
  inflating: eucarc                  
  inflating: iamrc                   
  inflating: cloud-cert.pem          
  inflating: jssecacerts             
  inflating: euca2-amberpet-fd1e7c85-pk.pem  
  inflating: euca2-amberpet-fd1e7c85-cert.pem  
[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]# source eucarc
[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]#{code}

By default normal user does have permission to launch instance.  So we have attached the following shown policies to user "james"

{code} [root@odc-d-06-05]#mkdir .euca-hyderabad
 [root@odc-d-06-05]#cd .euca-hyderabad/
 [root@odc-d-06-05]# ls
 [root@odc-d-06-05]# euca_conf --cred-account hyderabad --cred-user admin --get-credentials admin.zip
 [root@odc-d-06-05]# unzip -a admin.zip 
 [root@odc-d-06-05]#  source eucarc

[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-hyderabad] cat policy-1.json

{
  "Version": "2012-10-17",
  "Statement": [
    {
      "Sid": "Stmt1435665222439",
      "Action": "ec2:*",
      "Effect": "Allow",
      "Resource": "*"
    }
  ]
}

[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-hyderabad] cat policy-2.json

{
  "Version": "2012-10-17",
  "Statement": [
    {
      "Sid": "Stmt1435665222439",
      "Action": "s3:*",
      "Effect": "Allow",
      "Resource": "*"
    }
  ]
} {code}


Attached policies to normal user "james" as admin user account under "hyderabad".

{code}[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-hyderabad]#euare-useruploadpolicy -u james -p policy-1 -f /root/.euca-james/policy.json

[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-hyderabad]#euare-useruploadpolicy -u james -p policy-2 -f /root/.euca-james/policy-2.json{code}

Bundled, uploaded & registered Windows7 image using "euca-install-image" command under user "james"

{code}[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]# euca-install-image -n "windows-emi-image" -i /root/windows7_pro_x64.kvm.img -b "Windows-bucket" -r x86_64 --platform windows
/var/tmp/bundle-hUq0Mg/windows7_pro_x64.kvm.img.part.00 100% |==========================================================|  10.00 MB  34.56 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
/var/tmp/bundle-hUq0Mg/windows7_pro_x64.kvm.img.part.01 100% |==========================================================|  10.00 MB  29.82 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
/var/tmp/bundle-hUq0Mg/windows7_pro_x64.kvm.img.part.02 100% |==========================================================|  10.00 MB  34.77 MB/s Time: 0:00:00

/var/tmp/bundle-hUq0Mg/windows7_pro_x64.kvm.img.part.378 100% |=========================================================|  10.00 MB  18.96 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
/var/tmp/bundle-hUq0Mg/windows7_pro_x64.kvm.img.part.379 100% |=========================================================|   5.07 MB  17.61 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
/var/tmp/bundle-hUq0Mg/windows7_pro_x64.kvm.img.manifest.xml 100% |=====================================================|  59.81 kB  26.99 kB/s Time: 0:00:02
IMAGE	emi-e2cb4e6a {code}

Created key-pair for user "james" and added rules to SG group.

{code}[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]# euca-create-keypair testlogin -f testlogin.pem
KEYPAIR	testlogin	4d:7c:26:76:53:69:31:ee:64:3b:d0:49:7b:9b:e1:1e:d0:51:ae:c7
[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]# euca-describe-groups
GROUP	sg-0aa73ca1	000548044427	default	default group	
[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]# euca-authorize -P tcp -p 389 -s 0.0.0.0/0 default
GROUP	default
PERMISSION	default	ALLOWS	tcp	389	389	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0
[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]# euca-describe-groups
GROUP	sg-0aa73ca1	000548044427	default	default group	
PERMISSION	000548044427	default	ALLOWS	tcp	389	389	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]# euca-authorize -P icmp -t -1:-1 -s 0.0.0.0/0 default
GROUP	default
PERMISSION	default	ALLOWS	icmp	-1	-1	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0
[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]#{code}

Launched an instance under"james" user environment

{code}[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]# euca-run-instances -k testlogin -t m2.2xlarge emi-e2cb4e6a
RESERVATION	r-3380858f	000548044427	default
INSTANCE	i-38438979	emi-e2cb4e6a	10.104.15.124	10.104.15.124	pending	testlogin	0		m2.2xlarge	2015-07-01T10:59:55.776Z	one			windows	monitoring-disabled	10.104.15.124	10.104.15.124			instance-store				    hvm			sg-0aa73ca1				x86_64
[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]# {code}

Tried to run euca-bundle-instance command with eucalyptus admin credentials.

{code}[root@odc-d-06-05 ~]# euca-bundle-instance -b "test-windows-bucket" -p "test-image" -o AKIAADTUADNX6MX7NG3K -w BI5XQCW11TkuYNCbUkuzzVSqZTvVUzj50P3eECBx i-38438979
BUNDLE	bun-38438979	i-38438979	test-windows-bucket	test-image	2015-07-01T11:30:43.109Z	2015-07-01T11:30:43.109Z	pending	0   test-windows-bucket/test-image.manifest.xml
[root@odc-d-06-05 ~]#{code}

After completion of bundlinstance task. I have tried to register the image.

{code}[root@odc-d-06-05 ~]# euca-register test-windows-bucket/test-image.manifest.xml -n "windows-image" -a x86_64 --platform windows 
euca-register: error (AuthFailure): Manifest is not accessible {code}

If try to register same image under "james" user, I am able to register it successfully.

{code}[root@odc-d-06-05 .euca-james]# euca-register test-windows-bucket/test-image.manifest.xml -n "windows-image" -a x86_64 --platform windows
IMAGE	emi-d7b34d56 {code}

This issue re-producible in 4.0.2, 4.1.1 & 4.2 release.
fields.summary: Instances launched by normal (non-eucalyptus ) user can not be registered with eucalyptus admin credentials after BundleInstance step.

comments.body: I don't think system should allow to bundle someone's image. This looks like a valid behavior to me.
Kasim, this is how AWS behaves. Is there a use-case for this that would justify breaking AWS compatibility?
Would [~vasya], please, file a ticket for a more descriptive/accurate error message?  ("euca-register: error (AuthFailure): Manifest is not accessible" is not helpful)

[~dmitrii ]

I do not have access to AWS to verify the use case.

The "affects version/s" is listed as 4.2.0. The customer in question is actually on 4.0.2. Should we make the appropriate correction here?

Worth noting: Customer tried same steps on 3.4.3 and it was successful. Definitely not working on 4.0.2. Are we saying that the success on 3.4.3 was actually out of compliance?
After today's group discussion, Sang-Min suggested this would need to be a topic for discussion in engineering.

[~kasim.shaik], what is the use case here? We can think of some, but maybe there are other
interesting ones. This is something we'll consider for a maintenance release.

[~kshaik] I am not able to reproduce this issue in 4.2.1 this is working as described in the instructions above.
As admin:
{code}
[c-37:~/test/admin]euca-bundle-instance -b "test-windows-bucket" -p "test-image" -o AKIAAUHYDKEP2NSA4MUE -w vzSiahGmeskRCxqceJx0eGuLkvk6OdU0eZRDguJE i-dad8e9d6
BUNDLE	bun-dad8e9d6	i-dad8e9d6	test-windows-bucket	test-image	2016-01-07T16:51:38.053Z	2016-01-07T16:51:38.053Z	pending	0	test-windows-bucket/test-image.manifest.xml
[c-37:~/test/admin]euca-register test-windows-bucket/test-image.manifest.xml -n "windows-image" -a x86_64 --platform windows
IMAGE	emi-2cc3dbb0
{code}

Can you please test this in 4.2.1

[~kshaik] This is also not reproducible in 4.1.  I tested using the steps provided in the description and on both 4.1 and 4.2  the account admin can in fact bundle and register an instance installed by a user. Please let me know if I am missing something here?

[~kshaik] So your are first bundling and registering the instance as the user and then trying to re bundle and register the instance as admin. I was bundling the instance as-admin and then I could register the image as admin or user as was described in the reproduction. I will retest it with the new steps.
[~kshaik] I am still not able to reproduce this issue in my environment with the new steps. I will try and reproduce this in your environment.
[~kshaik] "10.104.1.221"  is an NC can you please point me to your CLC?
I am +1 that this is not a bug.
[~rusvika@eucalyptus.com]  I take it (AWS compatibility) to mean that like AWS  the "non system account"  admin/user can control bundling and registration of user images in that account.

When the cloud administrator bundles an instance from another account the resulting bucket and objects are owned by the cloud administrator but the meta-data in the manifest refers to the account that ran the (bundled) instance. It it this manifest meta-data mismatch that causes the observed failure, rather than the manifest or bucket ownership. This means that a modified workflow involving copying the bundled artifacts is not a solution.

Next steps for this issue are to be determined. There are some outstanding questions on the security of the cloud administrator bundling a users (another accounts) instance. The right solution for this issue could be a change to the product, new or updated client tools / scripts, or an alternative workflow for the use case (etc)
